titles: By the Major. Forasmuch as notwithstanding divers good acts and ordinancees of Parliament, and the frequent aadmonitions formerly given in this behalf by the present Lord Maior, this predecessors late Lord Maiors of this city, it is observed, that the Lords day, and the days of publike fast, are in these sad times of distraction and calamity much profaned, ...
author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor.
Warner, John, Sir, d. 1648.
publisher: Printed by Richard Cotes, Printer to the Honourable City of London,
notes: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Sunday legislation --  England --  Early works to 1800.
